verse: The word of God concerning all of Judah again came to Jeremiah when Jehoiakim (son of Josiah), king of Judah, had reigned for four years. Meanwhile, the dreaded Nebuchadnezzar was in his first year as king of Babylon.
During these ominous days the prophet Jeremiah spoke to the citizens of Jerusalem and the people of Judah.
This is what the Eternal God of Israel said to me.
So I took the cup from the Eternal’s hand and did just as He said—I went to the nations where He sent me and made them drink it:
Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, her kings and leaders drank from the cup and became a wasteland, an object of hissing, scorn, and cursing, a land of ruin;
then Pharaoh (king of Egypt), his advisors, his officers, and the entire nation,
including the foreigners living there; all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the Philistine kings in the cities of Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and what was left of Ashdod;
all the kings of Tyre, Sidon, and the other coastlands across the sea;
Dedan, Tema, Buz, and the nations who clip the corners of their hair;
all the kings of Arabia, the kings of the various desert nomadic tribes;
all the kings of Zimri, Elam, and Media;

all the kings of the north, both near and far. I went from one kingdom to another until every one of them on the face of the earth had drunk it. And then finally, the king of Sheshach[, that is, Babylon,] will drink from this cup.
Then He told me what to say to each of these nations and rulers.
This is what the Eternal, Commander of heavenly armies, has to say:
